head.supplied: ¶ [Baron von Mueller, in a letter complimenting the Borough Park Ranger on his special success in the cultivation of the marram grass, has suggested that Mr. Avery should consent to be nominated a me...

div.p:
Transcribed 9.9.93. To proof.
Letter not found. The text given here is from: Warrnambool standard, 1 July 1893, p. 4.
[Baron von Mueller, in a letter complimenting the Borough Park Ranger on his special success in the cultivation of the marram grass, has suggested that Mr. Avery should consent to be nominated a member of the "Royal Horticultural Society of England" (the Baron kindly proffering to be sponsor for the nomination) in order that he may not only communicate to the Society the practical success he has attained in this special department of arboriculture, but that Mr. Avery may in return receive publications of the Society for the benefit of the corporation by whom he is employed. But councillors laughed at the idea of "Sam" being a F.R.H.S., Eng., and they but common councillors. But I hope in the interests of the community, and not for any personal kudos, that Mr. Avery will consent to the Baron's thoughtful suggestion.
It is not known whether Avery was nominated for the Royal Horticultural Society; no nomination papers from this period can be found at the Society.
]
